data.value: Complete deleting files or folder has been canceled.

data.name: DialogMessageApplicationRestart
data.value: To enable this setting, you will need to restart the AttacheCase. Do you restart AttacheCase now?

data.name: labelDeleteError
data.value: An error occurred when deleting files or folders.

data.name: labelPasswordOfCommandLineOption
data.value: The password of command line option:

data.value: File association tool is not found.

data.name: DialogMessagefTemporarySettings
data.value: Because you are using the temporary settings from the command line option, it will not be able to reflect the change of main setting.

data.name: DialogMessageDecryptionPasswordFileNotFound
data.value: The specified password file is not found in decryption. The process is aborted.

data.name: DialogTitleAllPackFiles
data.value: Input encrypted file name for putting together

data.name: DialogMessageNotDirectoryInPasswordFile
data.value: Not use the folder to the password file.

data.value: Password does not match, it is invalid.

data.name: DialogMessageNotUseWindowsFileName
data.value:
The following characters cannot be used for the file name of Windows.
\\ / : , * ? \" < > |

data.name: labelCompleteDeletingCompleted
data.value: Files or folders complete deleting is completed normally.

data.name: DialogMessagePasswordFileNotFound
data.value: Password is not found that specified in setting panel.

data.name: folderBrowserDialogSaveToZipFile
data.value: Select the folder to save the zip file with password always.

data.name: DialogMessageFileIndexInvalid
data.value: Internal file index is invalid in encrypted file.

data.name: folderBrowserDialogSaveToDecryptedFile
data.value: Select the directory to which you save the file or folder to decrypt always.

data.name: DialogMessageNotSameHash
data.value: The file is not the same hash value. Whether the file is corrupted, it may have been made the falsification.The process is aborted.

data.name: labelCompleteDeleteError
data.value: Error occured during complete deleting files or folders.

data.name: labelNormalDeleteCanceled
data.value: Deleting files or folders has been canceled.

data.name: DialogMessageDragAndDropMixedFiles
data.value: There are files or folders that be encrypted or decrypted, and they are mixed, they does not exists. So, AttacheCase can not determine which should encrypt or decrypt either. It stopped the process.

data.name: labelMoveToTrashCompleted
data.value: Move files or folders to the trash was completed.

data.name: DialogMessageUnexpectedError
data.value: An unexpected error has occurred. And stops processing.

data.name: labelEncryptAlgoDescriptionAES
data.value: Values of WinZipAes128 and WinZipAes256 are not part of the Zip specification, but rather imply the use of a vendor-specific extension from WinZip. If you want to produce interoperable Zip archives, do not use these values. For example, if you produce a zip archive using WinZipAes256, you will be able to open it in Windows Explorer on Windows XP and Vista, but you will not be able to extract entries; trying this will lead to an "unspecified error". For this reason, some people have said that a zip archive that uses WinZip's AES encryption is not actually a zip archive at all. A zip archive produced this way will be readable with the WinZip tool (Version 11 and beyond).

data.name: labelEncryptAlgoDescriptionPkzipWeak
data.value:
PkzipWeak implies the use of Zip 2.0 encryption, which is known to be weak and subvertible.
A note on interoperability: Values of PkzipWeak and None are specified in PKWARE's zip specification, and are considered to be "standard". Zip archives produced using these options will be interoperable with many other zip tools and libraries, including Windows Explorer.

data.name: DialogMessageHigherVersion
data.value: This file has been encrypted with a higher version. It can not be decrypted. The process is aborted.

data.name: DialogMessageDirectoryNotFount
data.value: The folder to save is not found! Process is aborted.

data.name: DialogMessageDeleteEncryptedFiles
data.value: Are you sure to delete the encypted file(s) that are the source of the decryption?

data.name: DialogMessageBroken
data.value: Because it exceeded the limit number of inputting password, the encrypted file has been broken.

data.name: DialogMessageUnexpectedDecryptedFiles
data.value: Unexpected decrypted files. It stopped the process.

data.name: DialogMessageBothRandomAndZeroNotZero
data.value: Both Random setting and Zero setting are not able to set to zero.

data.name: DialogMessageOpenMultipleFiles

data.name: DialogMessageDeleteOriginalFilesAndFolders
data.value: Are you sure to delete the files and folders that are the source of the encrypted file?

data.value: File association tool can be not launched.

data.value: Access to the file has been denied. Move to a place (eg Desktop) where you can read and write files and try again.

data.value: Encrypted data not found. The file is broken. Decryption failed.
